title: Swfte International Circus font
content:
Hello,

I did a search for "Swfte" on the forums and did not find any hits.

One of my art directors wants to use Swfte International's "Circus" font.

1. Does anyone know if the outlines still exist for this font and who has the rights to it? I'd like to get it licensed.

2. Can you suggest a similar font that we can buy instead?

3. Anyone know the story behind Swifte? I remember them from way back but haven't heard of them in ages.

Thanks,

Kristin

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140406133321im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Circus_5967.gif)
author: kristin

comments.content:
I documented the SWFTE fonts here

[http://www.forgers.de/swfte.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20140406133321/http:/www.forgers.de/swfte.pdf "http://www.forgers.de/swfte.pdf")

It should be mentioned as an irony of fate that the SWFTE font forging company forged the fonts of the Bitstream font forging company, which had forged the Linotype font collection. Strangely enough, the Bitstream font forging company (and other font outfits, e.g. Adobe) sued the SWFTE font forging company (see the court file: Bitstream, Inc., et al., v. SWFTE International Ltd., Case No. 93-11068H, District of Mass.), i.e. „forger v. forger“, so to speak, but the claims of the font forging plaintiffs were dismissed by the Massachusetts court.
